# I-V Curve

The I-V Curve shows the relationship between [Current](20220408104411-current.md) and [Voltage](20220318120826-voltage.md)
![bd1ad63ff54367387e73a12c34b871a3](data:image/png;base64,)

## Circuit Element Characteristics

### Resistor

![](../60-Meta-Attachments/10e2c39c4c8f626c120dde810b108062.png)

![Circuit Diagram for Resistor I-V Circuit](data:image/png;base64,)A [resistor](20220221120700-resistor.md) $R$ satisfies [Ohm's Law](20220408120857-ohm's-law.md) $I=V/R$, so its I-V characteristic goes through the origin and has slope $1/R$.

## References

- [I-V Characteristics](https://faculty.math.illinois.edu/~dpv/ECE110Notes/content/course_notes/course_notes_files/IVCharacteristics.html)
